Row.Text: I'm not interested in this.
Ends Event with no effect.
Comet sighted!
A comet has appeared in our night sky. Some believe it to be a miracle, others an ill omen. Your advisors are unsure, and look to you for guidance. What does this mean?
This is a good omen.
{2_InstantYield}.
Our gods favor us.
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
Our priests will conduct a divination to see if this is a positive sign.
50% chance to gain {2_InstantYield}.
Divination successful!
Your priests believe that the divination was successful, and your [ICON_PEACE] Faith has increased greatly as a result.
Our observatories are going to learn a lot from this.
+500 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Shooting Stars

Last night a series of bright flashes of light filled the sky as a meteor shower visited our planet. Large meteorites have landed across the world. Your officials have collected one such specimen and brought it to the Capital for study. What should they do with it?
Break it up and send it to the Forge.
50% chance to gain 2 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron.
[ICON_RES_IRON] Iron extracted from meteorite!
Your smiths were able to break large lumps of iron out of the meteor, and can forge fine swords and spears from the material.
A gift from the heavens should be divided up and given to our priests.
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith in all Shrines.
Carve into decorative objects to be placed in my throne room.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Palace.
Donate it to the Universities for study.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from all Universities.
It belongs in a Museum.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from all Museums.
Eclipse!
Our people were surprised to witness an eclipse today. What does this mean for our empire?
I'm not sure what this means.
Gain {1_YieldCost}. 25% chance for this effect: {2_InstantYield}
Bad omen!
It was a bad omen.{4_Help}
Quick, make a sacrifice!
Expend {1_YieldCost} in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Science can explain this!
{2_InstantYield}
Quick, take a picture!
{2_InstantYield}
Heat wave!
Every summer seems hotter than the last, and our lakes and rivers are drying up. Soon, a drought may be upon us. What should we do?
Subsidize the farms.
{1_YieldCost}. You are confident that you can avoid a drought.
Set aside some emergency funds.
{1_YieldCost}. You are hopeful that you can avoid a drought.
Send money to local officials.
{1_YieldCost}. You are unsure that you can avoid a drought.
Grin and bear it. There's nothing we can do.
You are worried about a potential drought.
Ice age!
A sudden drop in average temperatures can only mean one thing: a small ice age! How should we prepare?
People should stay indoors, even if that means less commerce.
-2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
Take fuel from our industries and distribute it to the poor and needy.
-2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
Trains and steam power make us immune to the cold.
No negative effect.
Let's deal with problems as they arise.
Expect the cold to cause problems in our Cities.
Revolution!
To arms! Dissident civilians from across our empire have risen up to contest your rule! What will you do?
Let them eat cake.
2 Barbarians spawn near all owned Cities. 5 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest in all Cities.
Use our City-State connections to find common ground.
3 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest in all Cities.
We are all brothers and sisters of progress, are we not?
1 Barbarian spawns near every owned City, 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest in all Cities.
Find the leader and bribe him off.
{1_YieldCost}.
War fervor!
Your people clamor for war! Our martial spirit is high, and your military advisor wishes to know how you would like to channel this energy.
Rally the martial spirit of our people.
All valid units gain a temporary version of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Morale[ENDCOLOR] Promotion. +5 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for {4_Turns}.
Channel the energy into our industries.
+{3_CityYield} in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
The New World Order begins now!
10 turns (scaling with game speed) of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]We Love the King Day[ENDCOLOR] in all Cities. Military Academies produce +5 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for {4_Turns}.
For the Motherland!
Factories grant Cities +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for {4_Turns}.
Buy Victory Bonds!
Banks grant Cities +20% [ICON_GOLD] Gold for {4_Turns}.
War weariness!
The toll of war is hard on our people. They seek solace in the face of destruction and defeat, and look to you for guidance. How will you respond?
Give a speech at our Palace.
75% chance that all Cities will produce -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for the next {4_Turns}.
Speech unsuccessful!
The speech did not move your populace, and they are unhapppier as a result. -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities.{4_Help}
Have our religious leader pray for the wounded and deceased.
{1_YieldCost}.
Give a radio broadcast to the nation.
25% chance that all Cities will produce -2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Radio broadcast unsuccessful!
The radio broadcast did not move your populace, and they are unhapppier as a result. -2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities.{4_Help}
We must win. Begin conscription.
50% chance that all Cities will produce a military unit and begin 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance.
Conscription!
Conscription was successful, but your people are more angry than ever before. All cities experience 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance and produce 1 military unit.
Crowded Markets, Foreign Tongues

Crowds gather in your markets, voices from many different lands ringing out as deals are struck and bargains made. Some are angry about this, and believe that foreigners will destroy our trade. Others, however, encourage the foreign business, hoping to learn from their culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Let the foreigners continue to trade.
Markets in all cities: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Implement heavy taxes on imported goods.
Markets in all cities: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Icons of Our Past

Monuments represent the most important symbols of your culture. Your people seek to celebrate this by dedicating your Monuments to either their ancestors, or to their gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Dedicate Monuments to our fertility.
Monuments in all cities: +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
The gods are what is important now.
Monuments in all cities: +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Neither will suffice. The Monument should generate revenue.
Monuments in all cities: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Castle Doctrine

People are assembling at the gates of your Castle keeps, demainding safety during war time. Your castles are not large enough to accommodate entire cities, so you must decide: who should be given access to the keep during war?
The nobility, of course.
All Castles produce +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Our finest merchants and craftsmen, according to merit.
All Castles produce +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
The keep is not for citizens!
All Castles produce +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
The clergy, as willed by god.
All Castles produce +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
University Curriculum

Faculty and administration from your state Universities seek to create a unified curriculum for all current and future Universities in your empire. As head of state, they look to you for the final decision. Which would you prefer?
Focus on the hard sciences.
All Universities gain +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Liberal arts education is most important.
All Universities gain +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Divinity education will benefit us the most.
All Universities gain +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Military education seems most prudent.
All Universities gain +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Factory Partnerships

Businessmen approach your government, asking for permission to begin joint-ventures with your Factories. There are five competing partnership bids, and the your government needs guidance. Which would you prefer?
Let's produce luxury textiles.
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Cheap textiles sound lucrative.
Factories in all cities: +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Chemicals are a valuable asset
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Pharmaceuticals will benefit our local scientists.
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Canned goods will support our growing cities.
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
A New Banking System

The complexities of our banking systems are growing, and economic advisors recommend that you establish an empire-wide banking regulation. Guilds currently manage all money in our empire, but some believe this is an outdated management method. Some believe that centralization is the best option, but your advisors are torn on the issue. Of the following options, which do you prefer?
Decentralize it. Our people are more than capable of managing their own money.
All Laborers and Merchants produce +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Guilds should continue to manage our money.
All Banks produce +5% [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Centralize it. Money is too important to leave to private citizens.
All Banks produce +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
School Boards Established

School boards were recently established in your cities, and they seek to reform your public school system. They look to you for guidance: would you prefer free tuition for all students, or would you rather privatize the institutions?
Education should be free for everyone.
Public Schools in all cities: +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City.
Education should be available to those who can afford it.
Public Schools in all cities: +10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City.
Aging Windmills

Once the pinnacle of industrial design, our nation's Windmills now appear quite outdated. A few industrialists approach you about this topic, hoping to garner imperial support for the modernization of our Windmills. The following proposals are offered to you by these engineers. Which do you prefer?
Undertake a complete rework of our Windmills, starting immediately.
{1_YieldCost}. All Windmills gain a +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production boost.
Coordinate with our Manufactories and integrate them into our modern industrial processes.
{1_YieldCost} and 4 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron. All Windmills gain a +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production boost.
Retrofit them where we can, otherwise they're fine.
{1_YieldCost}. All Windmills gain a +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
World Sporting Event!

The World Sports Organization has chosen your empire to host the WSO International! For the next {4_Turns}, Cities with a Stadium will host games, boosting the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output of that City!
{3_PlayerName} to host World Sports Organization Tournament!
The WSO chose {3_PlayerName} to host their International Tournament. Their Stadiums will produce lots of [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism!{4_Help}
Research Setback
Your researchers regret to inform you that recent research was flawed, and had to be discarded. {1_YieldCost}.
Baby Boom!

Your population is growing exponentially, thanks to a large upswing in births as of late. All Cities gain +1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and experience 5 turns (scaling with game speed) of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]We Love the King Day[ENDCOLOR].
Plague Looming
Your advsiors tell you of a distant, virulent disease that is crippling other empires. Hopefully the disease stays far away from our cities...
Special Session

A diplomatic summit has been called to assess the budget of the World Congress. All our rival nations will be there, aiming to frustrate us. We must be shrewd if we are to come away richer than we entered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Given we can only work to one of many competing goals, who will you place at the head of our delegation?

International trade and friendship are the ultimate forces for good in this world. Appoint our Foreign Advisor to the head of the delegation. Tears down tariffs, closed borders and all other barriers to closer coorperation and understanding!
All Customs Houses produce +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. 10 turns (scaling with game speed) of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]We Love the King Day[ENDCOLOR] in all Cities.

Only by working together will we be able to unravel the secrets of the universe! Place our Science Advisor in charge. We must come away with a leading voice in the world's greatest scientific organisations.
Gain {1_YieldCost}. 16.66% chance for a Free Technology.
Research Grant
Your Science Advisor notes that our leverage over the international research council has successfully unlocked a new technology.

A summit like this gives us an unprecedented opportunity to enact cross-border monetary policy. If our Economic Advisor plays her cards right, we should be able to unlock vast amounts of capital. Now, and in the future.
Gain an injection of {2_InstantYield}. The Bank permanently increases the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital's [ICON_GOLD] Gold output by 5%.

The idea of an international peacekeeping organisation has gathered support around the world. We cannot allow such a force to exist without being at its head. Send our Military Advisor as our chief representative. Argue strongly for this army, and for our men as its leaders.
The nations of the world respect your resolve, earning you {2_InstantYield}. A new army appears near the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
Death of a Merchant

A wealthy merchant in your empire has died, and he left behind an ambiguous will. His two sons, one a sailor and the other a banker, each have legal claim to the inheritance, and have petitioned the state for resolution. What will you decide?
I don't care, however I do intend to tax the inheritance.
+{2_InstantYield}.
The banker's case is more sound, as his investments match those of his father.
Receive a free Caravan in your Capital.
The sailor's ideas would benefit all of our coastal cities.
+{3_CityYieldGlobal} in all coastal Cities.
A Question of Hygiene

As the popularity of bathing continues to rise, so too does demand. Citizens in your empire demand additional baths, however elites and aristocrats protest this, stating that baths are a luxury. Your advisors need your input on this. How do you feel?
The unwashed masses should remain unwashed.
Receive a free Great Person of your choice.
Spare no expense - the people shall be clean!
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities. All Baths cost an additional 3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Encourage people to find more...creative means of getting clean.
Aqueducts in all Cities: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
I'm not interested in this.
Nothing happens.
Rich Vein

A rich vein of blue marble was discovered at the quarry near the city. Your miners and masons have come to you to ask you what you would like to do with it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the options below...
Boast of this, and merchants will come to buy it from us.
+{2_InstantYield}, and 10 turns (scaling with game speed) of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]We Love the King Day[ENDCOLOR] in the City.
Donate it to the Temple.
{2_InstantYield}.
Carve relics and idols from it.
{2_InstantYield}
Give it to our finest artists.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City for {5_Turns}.
Old Men and the Sea
A band of local fishermen have appealed to the City for funding for a seasonal fishing expedition.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the following options...
Let's focus on something simple.
Spend {1_Scaled}. Gain {2_InstantYield} Food in the City.
A large investment will pay dividends.
Spend {1_Scaled}. Fishing Boats near the City will gain +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food for {5_Turns}.
I'd rather invest in something much more lucrative...
Invest {1_Scaled}. 50% chance for a Harbor to be constructed in the City.
Harbor Constructed!
The investment in {2_City} was successful and paid for construction!
Dramatic Masterpiece
Writers from the City have penned a new work, and critics are calling it a 'masterpiece.' News of this has reached your ear, and your advisors await your response.
Send news to the other civilizations of the world.
{1_YieldCost}. Gain {2_InstantYield} Tourism with all known Civilizations.
Writers from {2_CityName} create a masterpiece.
Writers from {2_City} have penned a new dramatic work, attracting visitors from around the world.
Let's celebrate this.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Make sure the writers are praised for this.
Gain {4_GPChange} points in the City.
They should have been praying instead.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Trouble at the Temple

Priests from the City demand that you weigh in on a religious debate. As the City grows, more and more people of different faiths are asking for use of the Temple. People of the majority faith resent this, and threaten violence if you allow nonbelievers into the Temple. Nonbelievers, however, threaten to leave if you do not let them in. What will you do?
Good riddance.
-1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, and 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Let them in, but make them pay for it.
Temple gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith. -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in City.
Reject the nonbelievers.
50% chance that the Temple is destroyed. If so, the city gains +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Temple in {2_City} destroyed!
The nonbelievers in {2_City} struck out at the Temple, burning it to the ground in protest. Your people are not shaken, however. City receives +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, and: {5_Help}
We should think bigger.
{1_YieldCost}. The Temple is destroyed, and a Grand Temple is built in its place.
Beacon of Hope
Fishermen in the City are concerned about the fate of the City's Lighthouse. In recent years it has fallen under disrepair, and it needs to be rebuilt. How should we deal with this?
Let private citizens manage it.
Lighthouse gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
The city should manage it.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. The Lighthouse gains +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Sell off the land.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. The Lighthouse is destroyed.
Hospital Overcrowding

Soldiers from the front pour into this City every day, and the wards are now filled with patients. Local doctors do not know what to do with the overflow, and have petitioned your government for support. What will you do?
Send emergency funding.
For the next {5_Turns}, the City produces -5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but gains +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Triage is the only option.
Implement a triage system, saving those that we can. The City loses 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
This is not our problem.
City produces -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness permanently.
Set up a permanent stipend for the Hospital.
City produces -5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but gains +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness permanently.
Send all deceased to our Research Lab.
50% chance that the City will experience 3 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. If so, the Hospital gains +4 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Hospital science experiments discovered!
Cadavers were delivered to our Research Lab, however the public is outraged at our callousness.
Stadium Sellout!
A game was held in your stadium as part of the WSO International! You gain 500 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with all known Civilizations, and 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Game Day
The City's Stadium is preparing for game day! Unfortunately, it seems the manager misplaced his schedule, and he can't remember what kind of event is happening! What's going on here, again?
A skiing competition, obviously.
Gain 100 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 75 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Water sports, obviously.
Gain 100 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 75 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Pretty sure it was football. No, the American kind.
Gain 200 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Pretty sure it was football. Yeah, the real kind.
Gain 200 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
A sporting event? No, it was a ceremony.
Gain 400 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Nuclear meltdown!

The worst has happened. The City's Nuclear Plant has had a meltdown, rendering vast sections of the city uninhabitable. The building is destroyed, and all other buildings in the City are at risk. The City loses 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Drought
Drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Severe Drought
Severe drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and a nearby Farm is pillaged.
Critical Drought
Critical drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and 2 nearby Farms are pillaged.
Exposure
Sub-zero temperatures have left many people in the City at risk to exposure. -1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City.
Fuel Shortage
Due to extreme cold, the City is currently experiencing a fuel shortage. Further supplies have been diverted from our industries to compensate. {1_YieldCost} towards the City's current task.
Frozen Waters
The city's river has frozen over, severely hampering commerce. -3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City for {5_Turns}.
Bitter Winds
Bitterly cold winds are severely hampering production in the lands around the City. For {5_Turns}, all Quarries, Pastures, Farms, and Lumbermills produce -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Mining Accident
A mineshaft near the City struck some kind of liquid reservoir, and has begun filling with fluid.
Collapse the tunnels to preserve what we can.
Bury the compromised branch of the Mine. It enters the Pillaged state.
Reassign engineers from the City to close-off the breach with minimal loss of tunnel access.
Delay the City's current building project by {1_YieldCost} but save the Mine.
The fluid appears to be rich in oil. Use our ground-penetrating radar to pinpoint the reserve and begin extraction!
Spend {1_YieldCost} to receive 1 [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil.
Bearing the Smoke
Underbrush in a nearby Forest has set ablaze, forcing workers out of the Forest until the fires abate.
There's nothing we can do but wait this out. Those mens' lives are more important than our logging operation.
Up to two Lumbermills near the City are pillaged.
Send in firefighters with water and axes, protect our infrastructure at all costs!
{1_YieldCost} worth of men succumb to the flames.
Call in our reserve aircraft to water-bomb the fires and spread retardent fertilizer from the air.
Expend {1_YieldCost}. Lush growth burgeons where the fire once raged, nearby Forests yield +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Avalanche
Snow melt from a nearby mountain has collapsed, causing a massive avalanche. Up to two Villages and two Farms near the City are pillaged.
Local Corruption
Administrators in this City are currently facing charges of corruption. The people are angry, and demand some semblance of justice. A scapegoat is needed. Who will you blame?
The Minister of Agriculture is to blame.
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
I knew the Corp of Engineers was up to no good.
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
Someone's been stealing money from the treasury?
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
I'll take the blame, I guess.
-2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in the City for {5_Turns}.
Spoiled Food
A large portion of food in the Granary spoiled, no doubt due to mismanagement. {1_YieldCost} in the City.
Bandits!
Bandits assaulted your tax collectors, making off with the money! {1_YieldCost}.
Great Harvest
Farmers in the City report an excellent harvest this season. +{2_InstantYield} in the City.
Market Day
Market Day has begun, and the City's marketplace is filled with customers. For the next {5_Turns}, the City's Market produces +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Eruption!

Oh no! A once-dormant mountain near the City has suddenly erupted, pouring down lava into the City and the surrounding countryside! Effects: -3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, multiple Improvements are pillaged, and many City buildings are damaged!
Krakatoa Erupts!

Krakatoa has erupted! Massive plumes of ash, smoke, and lava have enveloped the nearby City and its countryside. Effects: -3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, Improvements are pillaged, and many Buildings are damaged!
Resort near Natural Wonder
As a result of the tourism generated by a nearby Natural Wonder, a business consortium decided to construct a Hotel in this City.
Pestilence
Crops are found rotting in the earth. It is not clear how far the infection has spread, but a large part of the harvest has been compromised.
Burn the blighted fields.
The farming communities near the City are devastated. Up to two Farms near the City enter the Pillaged state.
Attempt to replant before winter.
Take {1_YieldCost} from the City's Granary in order to seed another set of crops and allow the region's agriculture to continue as normal.
Design a bespoke fungicide to eradicate the disease.
Allocate {1_YieldCost} of researchers to permanently increase the yield of nearby Farms by +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Floods
The City's river level has risen dangerously high, threatening the City and surrounding countryside.
Endure the floods.
Up to 3 Farms are Pillaged, and some buildings may be destroyed as well.
Send labourers to construct flood defenses.
Reallocate {1_YieldCost} from the City's building project to save the farmlands, though some buildings may still be destroyed.
Design a control system at the Hydro Plant to regulate the River's water level.
Allocate {1_YieldCost} of researchers to permanently solve flooding in this region. Receive a boost of {4_GPChange}.
Hurricane approaches

A hurricane looms on the horizon, and is headed straight for the City. It may or may not hit the city. If it does, expect major losses of life and property. The City's council is unsure of how to respond, and looks to you for guidance.
Evacuate the City and sandbag everything.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. The City is well-prepared for the hurricane.
Hurricane strikes {2_City}!
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. Thankfully, the City was well-prepared, and was minimally damaged.
Buckle down and hope for the best. There's nothing we can do.
No preparation. Good luck!
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City was not well-prepared, and was horribly damaged.
Send in the military to protect property.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. If the hurricane hits, expect large losses of life.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City itself was well-protected, but the population suffers.
Send in the military to protect the populace.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City's population was well-protected, but the City itself was decimated.
Our river's levee will protect us from surge water!
Lose {1_YieldCost} and rely on the river's levee. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City's levee did not hold, and the City was devastated.
Plague!
Our worst fears have come true. Plague has reached the City! People lie dead in the streets, and hundreds more die every day. Effect: -15 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City for {5_Turns}.
Mysterious Wanderer

A cloaked figure lingers outside the City's Walls. When asked why he has come to the city, he hands the guard a tattered letter:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am a man of many talents, but I have no home. Mute since birth, I teach and train without words. I can offer you one of four talents in exchange for hospitality and a home."
"The gift of the artist."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the craftsman."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the soothsayer."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the trader."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
Nomadic Incursion

A group of nomadic peoples have appeared at your borders, and petition for the right to settle in your territory. They seem friendly, and are willing to negotiate in order to gain what they desire. How do you respond?
Give them land, but only if they adapt to our culture.
Gain {2_Instant} towards Border Growth in this City (only affects Border Growth).
Drive them out, and steal whatever we can take.
Receive {1_Cost}. 50% chance that two Barbarian units will spawn near the City.
Nomadic retaliation against {2_City}!
Your brazen actions angered the nomads, and they have declared war on you! Two Barbarian units spawn near {2_City}.
Invite them to settle, but only if their finest soldiers join our army.
A free military Unit spawns near your City.
Invite them to integrate into the City.
City gains 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen.
La Resistance

Threats against your rule continue to grow in the City, and your advisors are worried that it may spill over into violence. You need to root out this resistance before it grows too strong. Your options are limited, however:
They'll never expect the inquisition!
